channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-14988] Support INSERT OVERWRITE into a partition on transactional tables
item.description:
Insert overwrite operation on transactional table will currently raise an error.
This can/should be supported

This is implemented by using the concept of base_N/ directory in Acid.
INSERT OVERWRITE starts a new transaction N and creates a new base_N directory where it writes the data.
This has the effect that on read all files with transaction IDs < N are ignored.
The advantage is that IOW doesn't need to be a mutexed operation. All readers that stared before this IOW can proceed at the
snapshot (Acid tables support at Snapshot Isolation) they locked in.

If mutexed semantics are desired we could add an option where IOW will request an X lock but the base_N/ based implementation can support both.
item.summary: Support INSERT OVERWRITE into a partition on transactional tables

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Hello, I am deferring this to Hive 3.0 as we are going to cut the first RC and it is not marked as blocker. Please feel free to commit to the branch if this can be resolved before the release.
HIVE-14988.01.patch - explore "write directly to new base_X" idea
HIVE-14988.02.patch - explore "store minWaterMark" idea

patch 03 is following the "new base" approach proposed by Eugene.

For example, we have such directory layout:

delta_1_1
delta_2_2
base_2
delta_3

After an Insert Overwrite, it should become like this:

delta_1_1
delta_2_2
base_2
delta_3
base_4 <= new base. All other dirs become obsolete.

+1 LGTM

FYI, it may be easier to check for files names like this using INPUT_FILE_NAME VirtualColumn, for example TestTxnCommands.testNonAcidToAcidConversion01()

It may be good to move the 2 new tests in TestTxnCommands2 to TestTxnCommands. The former has 2 subclasses which rerun all the tests in Split Update mode and vectorized mode. I don't think there is value in that for these tests - just adds to runtime.

This can be done in later.
Committed patch 6 to master. Thanks Eugene for the review.

Does this need to be documented in the wiki?

If so, does it belong in the Transactions doc or the DML doc, or both?

  • Hive Transactions
  • DML – Inserting values into tables from queries
  • DML – Inserting values into tables from SQL

leftylev Thanks for catching that. INSERT OVERWRITE is not a new feature, so I don't think we need to highlight this. But we do need to remove one bullet item under here: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/LanguageManual+DML#LanguageManualDML-Synopsis.1

"As of Hive 0.14, if a table has an OutputFormat that implements AcidOutputFormat and the system is configured to use a transaction manager that implements ACID, then INSERT OVERWRITE will be disabled for that table.  This is to avoid users unintentionally overwriting transaction history.  The same functionality can be achieved by using TRUNCATE TABLE (for non-partitioned tables) or DROP PARTITION followed by INSERT INTO."
Okay, but let's just update that bullet instead of removing it, since it remains true for Hive 0.14.0 through 2.x.x.
Sure of course Thank you!
Hive 3.0.0 has been released so closing this jira.
